title: William Shakespeare - 7 - As You Like It - Caedmon 1963
description:
Now, my co-mates and brothers in exile,Ã‚Â 
Hath not old customs make this life more sweetÃ‚Â 
Than that of painted pomp? Are not these woodsÃ‚Â 
More free from peril than the envious court!Ã‚Â 
Here feel we not the penalty of Adam,Ã‚Â 
The seasons difference; as the icy fangÃ‚Â 
And churlish chiding of the winters wind,Ã‚Â 
Which when it bites and blows upon my body,Ã‚Â 
Even till I shrink with cold, I smile and sayÃ‚Â 
This is no flattery; these are counsellorsÃ‚Â 
That feelingly persuade me what I am.Ã‚Â 
Sweet are the uses of adversity;Ã‚Â 
Which, like the toad, ugly and venomous,Ã‚Â 
Wears yet a precious jewel in his head;Ã‚Â 
And this our life, exempt from public haunt,Ã‚Â 
Finds tongues in trees, books in the running brooks,Ã‚Â 
Sermons in stones, and good in everything.Ã‚Â 
I would not change it.Ã‚Â  

CD rip of a delightful play with a delightful performance of Rosalind by Vanessa Redgrave. Bernard Shaw wrote of Rosalind that 'she is simply an extension into five acts of the most affectionate, fortunate, delightful five minutes in the life of a fortunate woman.' - she is not a character so much as the characterization of a mood, an exquisite poetic essence. Other major players in this excellent performance are Keith Michell and Max Adrian.

(Kindly seed, and if you can't find a seed for any previous poetry torrent go to the folder 'Current Poetry Torrents' and follow the instructions on the pdf.)
